New Records: Kyle Schwarber set an MLB record with his 14th leadoff homer of the season
Key Match Events: Trea Turner hit two, two-run homers
Cal Stevenson hit a tiebreaking two-run double in the eighth inning
Harper doubled and Uceta hit a pitch that caused benches and bullpens to empty
Turner also homered off Bradley in the third inning and had his 17th career multi-homer game
Harper was given a double due to fan interference
Post-Match Reflections: Schwarberâ€™s 35th homer of the season was the 45th leadoff homer of his career, with 32 coming since joining the Phillies in 2022
Jose Alvarado (2-5) pitched a perfect eighth inning with two strikeouts and earned the victory
The Rays nickel-and-dimed Phillies starter Ranger Suarez for four runs on 12 hits in the first six innings
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tampa Bay Rays' Taj Bradley gave up a two-run home run to Trea Turner in the third inning
Christopher Morel had an RBI triple off the top of the wall in center field
Richard Lovelady (3-6) was tagged with the loss
